item.title: Jean add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Jean add a quote by Carrie Chapman Catt
item.description: "More powerful than kings and armies is an idea whose time has come to move." -- Carrie Chapman Catt

item.title: Jean add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jean add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jean add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description:
"The smell of good bread baking, like the sound of lightly flowing water, is indescribable in its evocation of innocence and delight...
[Breadmaking is] one of those almost hypnotic businesses, like a dance from some ancient ceremony. It leaves you filled with one of the world's sweetest smells... there is no chiropractic treatment, no Yoga exercise, no hour of meditation in a music-throbbing chapel. that will leave you emptier of bad thoughts than this homely ceremony of making bread." -- M.F.K. Fisher

item.title: Jean add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description: "No yoga exercise, no meditation in a chapel filled with music will rid you of your blues better than the humble task of making your own bread." -- M.F.K. Fisher

item.title: Jean add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Laughter is the language of the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jean add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "I cried because I had no shoes. Then I met a man who had no feet." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jean add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "The world turns on our every action, and our every omission, whether we know it or not." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Jean add a quote by Richard Leigh
item.description: "You’ve got to sing like you don’t need the money, Love like you’ll never get hurt. You’ve got to dance like nobody’s watchin’." -- Richard Leigh

item.title: Jean add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jean add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "There never will be complete equality until women themselves help to make laws and elect lawmakers." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Jean add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jean add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is to not stop questioning." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jean add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Jean add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "The past is behind, learn from it. The future is ahead, prepare for it. The present is here, live it." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Jean add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "All sorrows are less with bread. " -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Jean add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "How can a nation be called great if its bread tastes like kleenex?" -- Julia Child

item.title: Jean add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "The best things are nearest: breath in your nostrils, light in your eyes, flowers at your feet, duties at your hand, the path of God just before you. Then do not grasp at the stars, but do life's plain common work as it comes certain that daily duties and daily bread are the sweetest things of life." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jean add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I shouldn't think even millionaires could eat anything nicer than new bread and real butter and honey for tea." -- Dodie Smith
